sentence.Network_en: Then the young mother mentioned some shockingly modern succedaneum.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: modern Latin, neuter of Latin succedaneus 'following after', from succedere 'come close after' (see succeed)

means.word_mean: 1. (medicine) something that can be used as a substitute (especially any medicine that may be taken in place of another)
